correctAnswer: 3NT 3NT: 0-4 HCP with a balanced hand and 0-2 cards in the bid suit.

4♣ 4♣: 0-4 HCP with 3+ cards in the bid suit, showing support for the bid suit. Later we will expand that 4d is a question for K/A in suit, and the replay is the bid suit and that 4h is a question for what picture you have in clubs 4s=Q/K 4nt=A 5c=None.
3♠ 3♠: 5-8 HCP with spades significantly better than other suits, and no 3 clubs (e.g., 6-3-3-1 distribution).
3♥ New suit: 5-8 HCP with the intention to bid 4 of the repeated suit to show 3+ cards later or 3NT to show 2 or fewer cards in the bid suit.
3NT 3NT: 0-4 HCP with a balanced hand and 0-2 cards in the bid suit.

4♦ 4♦: 0-4 HCP with 3+ cards in the bid suit, showing support for the bid suit. Later we will expand that 4♥ is a question for K/A in suit, and the replay is the bid suit and that 4♠ is a question for what picture you have in clubs 4NT=Q/K 5c=A 5d=None
3♠ 3♠: 5-8 HCP with the intention to bid 4 of the repeated suit to show 3+ cards later, dont bid this suit if you dont have 3+ diamonds.
4♣ 4♣: 5-8 HCP with clubs significantly better than other suits, and no 3 Diamonds (e.g., 6-3-3-1 distribution).
3♥ New suit: 5-8 HCP with the intention to bid 4 of the repeated suit to show 3+ cards later or 3NT to show 2 or fewer cards in the bid suit.
4♦ 4♦: Interested in slam in hearts or spades.

3NT 3NT: 9-11 HCP, really balanced hand (could be 5-4-3-1).
2NT 2NT: 12-14 HCP, really balanced hand (could be 5-4-3-1).
2♥ 12-16 points, bid one above and then bid the singleton.

3♥ 9-11 points, bid the singleton ignoring the bid right above.
2♠ 2♠: Indicates a void, expressing hope for a potential slam.
2NT 2NT: 8-10 points balanced hand.
3♣ 3♣: 11-12 points balanced hand.
3♠ Partner describes his void. If he cannot because the answer was said by partner, he says 3NT, which is a question for aces ignoring the void suit.
3NT Partner describes his void. If he cannot because the answer was said by partner, he says 3NT, which is a question for aces ignoring the void suit.
4♦ Partner described his void in clubs by saying 3NT, which is a question for aces ignoring the void suit.

2NT 2NT: 15-16 points balanced hand.
3♣ 3♣: 12-14 points 5+ diamonds.
3♦: 15 16 points 5+ diamonds.

3♦ 3♦: 15-17 with 3-4 diamonds.
3♠ 3♠: 15-16 with 3-4 diamonds.
3NT 3NT: 17 with 3-4 diamonds.
3♥ 3♥: 18 with 3-4 diamonds.
3♠ 3♠: 19 with 3-4 diamonds.
3NT 3NT: 20 with 3-4 diamonds.
3♥ 3♥/♠ (openers suit): Has 3 cards of openers suit but prefers the 4-5 cards of other major suit.
4♠ He prefers the 4-5 cards of other major suit by his 3h bid.
3♦ 2NT: Have a void and are interested in slam. Opener needs to bid 3♣ if he is 12-14 and 3♦ if he is 15-16, and then the responder bids their void.
2♠ 2♠: This bid indicates a very strong hand with a void, providing the partner with valuable information about your hands strength and distribution.
2NT: S♥OW♠ A ♥AN♦ WIT♥ 12 13 points.
3♣: S♥OW♠ A ♥AN♦ WIT♥ 13 14 points.

3♠ 2NT: Indicates a singleton or void in clubs, hoping the partner has a second long suit of at least 4 cards and can bid it at the 3 level. If the bid becomes competitive, the responder can then bid their longest suit, and the opener will know it is weak.
3NT 3NT: Balanced, 13-14, or 12 with 5+ diamonds.
3♣ 3♣: 15-20 balanced with at least 3 clubs.
3♥ 3♥: 15-16 balanced with at least 3 clubs.
3♠ 3♠: 17-18 balanced with at least 3 clubs.
3NT 3NT: 19-20 balanced with at least 3 clubs.
3♦ 3♦: 15-16 balanced with exactly 2 clubs.
3♠ 3♠: I have a Q or J in ♣, 15-16 balanced with exactly 2 clubs.
3NT 3NT: I do not have a Q or J in ♣, 15-16 balanced with exactly 2 clubs.
3♥ 3♥: 17-18 balanced with exactly 2 clubs.
3♠ 3♠: 19-20 balanced with exactly 2 clubs.
4♠ If you have the king: bid the suit of the king. 4♦: A question for king (ignoring ace).
4NT If you dont have the king respond with 4NT. 4♦: A question for king (ignoring ace).
5♣ 5♣: I don't have a queen. 4NT: A question for queen.
5♦ 5♦: I do have a queen. 4NT: A question for queen.
3♠ 3♠: A 6-5 distribution in clubs and diamonds with 2 cards in spades.
3NT 3NT: Diamonds is the other suit in the 6-5 distribution.
3NT 3NT: Hearts is the other suit in the 6-5 distribution.
